subject: Medicine
title: The Reward System
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Reward System.

hook.text: Every like on social media triggers a tiny dopamine hit in your brain. Tech companies designed it that way.

buildup.text: The brain's reward system releases dopamine when you eat, exercise, or achieve a goalâ€”reinforcing the behavior.

discovery.text: Dopamine doesn't create pleasureâ€”it creates wanting. It drives you to seek the reward, not enjoy it.

twist.text: Addictive drugs hijack this system, flooding it with dopamine and rewiring the brain to crave more.

climax.text: Understanding the reward system explains addiction, compulsive eating, gambling, and phone dependency.

punchline.text: Dopamine makes you want, not happy.

quiz.question: What does dopamine actually create in the brain?
options: The desire to seek rewards, not the pleasure itself
Direct feelings of happiness and satisfaction
